name: NPR
text:
Many law enforcement agencies in suburban Minneapolis and St. Paul that policed protests were the beneficiaries of a Pentagon program that distributed more than $1 billion worth of military gear to local police departments. 
https://t.co/UNe9zO3ceN

name: NPR
text:
In an April survey of nearly 500 Wisconsinites with disabilities and older adults, every respondent said COVID-19 has disrupted their caregiving service.

And the state was already facing a shortage of caregivers before the pandemic.
https://t.co/xsoaQL8pLa

name: NPR
text:
Lainy is a preschool teacher who's been out of work since mid-March.

Because preschool teachers are "chronically underpaid," she says, unemployment benefits add up to about $500 a month more than she made when she was working.
https://t.co/6zAUEgVK4q

name: NPR
text:
Black women experience higher rates of diseases and suffer from stressors of systemic racism.

GirlTrek is organizing team walks to foster health and healing.

"When women walked and talked together," says co-founder T. Morgan Dixon, "everything changed."
https://t.co/FGkhxPTmJs

name: NPR
text:
A few tips for making the workplace more equitable for your trans coworkers:

• Do your own research instead of asking intrusive questions

• Be intentional about your language and correct mistakes

• Look beyond inclusion and push for true equity
https://t.co/TeT9uGVPrd

name: NPR
text:
The Justice Department is suing former national security adviser John Bolton to block the publication of his tell-all memoir. The lawsuit alleges the book would compromise national security.
https://t.co/mq7qUmMU8s

name: NPR
text: RT @rdlewis: Florida, Texas and Arizona all moved to reopen quickly and now have set daily records for the number of COVID-19 cases. In Florida, officials are sparring over exactly why the numbers are going up so quickly (by @gallennpr) https://t.co/N6b7rOP8FM

name: NPR
text: The University of Virginia will change the athletic department's logo because it contains a reference to the university's history with slavery. https://t.co/blQwy8lQBa

name: NPR
text:
The Navy is mobilizing 1,629 reservists to help reduce the aircraft and submarine maintenance backlog that has developed because of the COVID-19 pandemic. 
https://t.co/QxZi8xiQcY

name: NPR
text:
No Federal Reserve chair has ever been publicly ridiculed as much as Jerome Powell. And that's despite the central bank's unprecedented efforts to save the American economy.

But Powell shows no sign of caving to pressure.
https://t.co/XmnCYqpw9B

name: NPR
text:
Thailand's coronavirus lockdown has kept the number of cases low. But the economic toll has led to a mental health crisis.
https://t.co/fvBCjbHAAk

name: NPR
text: If you or someone you know may be considering suicide, call the U.S. National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-… https://t.co/agIxc1ZwbF
